p: Fucoidans are heteropolysaccharides rich in L-fucopyranosyl sulfated units linked by (α1→2), (α1→3) or (α1→4) bonds. Other monosaccharides can be present, such as galactopyranosyl, mannopyranosyl, xylosepyranosyl and uronic acids [ 68]. The naturally higher content of sulfate groups and the presence of acetyl groups are associated with a higher stimulatory activity [ 56].
